coloradocollege.ifroning
Class Location

java.lang.Object
  coloradocollege.ifroning.Location

public class Location
extends java.lang.Object

A location has a static description, activators that may change in state and items that may be added or removed. Every location has 6 potential neighbors: north, east, south, west, up and down.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Ian Froning

Constructor Detail

Location

public Location()
Constructs an empty location.

Location

public Location(java.lang.String aDescription,
                ActivatorList anActivatorList,
                LocationInventory anInventory)
Constructs a location.

Parameters:
aDescription - the description of the room - what the player sees when they enter the location
anActivatorList - the ActivatorList that contains the activators in the room
anInventory - the inventory of items in the room

Location

public Location(java.lang.String aDescription,
                boolean isFinalLocation)
Constructs a final location (the location that stops all player input).

Parameters:
aDescription - the description of the room - what the player sees when they enter the location
isFinalLocation - set to true if the location is the final location

Returns true if this location is the final location (the location that stops all player input).

addNeighbor

public void addNeighbor(java.lang.String direction,
                        Location location)
Adds a neighbor North, East, South, West, above or below this location.

Parameters:
direction - "N" for North, "E" for East, "S" for South, "W" for West "U" for up, or "D" for down
location - the location to be added as a neighbor

addRequiredActivators

public void addRequiredActivators(java.lang.String direction,
                                  ActivatorList theRequiredActivators,
                                  java.lang.String anErrorMessage)
Blocks a direction to the player and adds an activator list whose activators must all be activated in order to allow passage.

Parameters:
direction - the direction that will be blocked until all the required activators have been activated
theRequiredActivators - the activator list of activators that must be activated
anErrorMessage - the message displayed if the player tries to move in the blocked direction

changeLocation

public Location changeLocation(java.lang.String direction)
Changes the location to the location that is in the given direction.

Parameters:
direction - "N" for North, "E" for East, "S" for South, "W" for West "U" for up, or "D" for down
Returns:
the new location or void if there is no location
